page.title: 10St Mary's Church, Gayton
page.content: The Church of St Mary the Virgin stands in the north-east corner of Gayton. It has a Saxon tower and walls that were built about 800 years ago. Much has been added since. There are a number of carved tombs in the church. One, of Sir Philip de Gayton, is wooden. Another statue was probably carved by Wm. de Ireland who also made "Queen Eleanor's Cross" just outside Northampton. Although Gayton has a population of about 490 only 50 people are actively involved in the church today. The attendances at services rage from 30 on Sunday mornings to 6 in the evening.These figures have not changed for 15 years.The Church has a regular choir of 4 but no other organised groups. During the year there are usually 2 weddings, 6 funerals, 5 christenings and 5 confirmations.
